column1: 1 ^ Beáti immaculáti in via
column2: qŭi ámbulant in lege Dòmini. ^ Blessed are the undefiled in the way
column3: who walk in the law of the Lord.

column1: 2 ^ Beáti qŭi scrutántur testimónia ejus~; in toto corde exquírent eum. ^ Blessed are they that search his testimonies~; they will seek him with their whole heart.
3 ^ Non enim qŭi operántur iniqŭitátem in viîs ejus ambulavérunt. ^ For they that work iniquity have not walked in his ways.
4 ^ Tu mandavìsti mandáta tua custodíri nìmis. ^ Thou hast commanded thy commandments to be kept most diligently.
5 ^ Útinam dirigántur viaĕ meaĕ ad custodièndas justificatiónes tuas. ^ O that my ways may be directed to keep thy justifications.
6 ^ Tunc non confùndar
column2: qŭum perspèxero in òmnibus mandátîs tuîs. ^ Then shall I not be confounded
column3: when I shall look into all thy commandments.

column1: 7 ^ Confitébor tìbi in directióne cordis
column2: in eo qŭod dìdici judìcia justìtiaĕ tuaĕ. ^ I will praise thee with uprightness of heart
column3: when I shall have learned the judgments of thy justice.

column1: 8 ^ Justificatiónes tuas custódiem~; non me derelìnqŭas usquequáque. ^ I will keep thy justifications~; do not thou utterly forsake me.
9 ^ ¿~In qŭo córrigit adolescèntior viam suam~? In custodièndo sermónes tuos. ^ By what doth a young man correct his way~? By observing thy words.
10 ^ In toto corde meo exqŭisívi te~; ne repèllas me a mandátîs tuîs. ^ With my whole heart have I sought after thee~; let me not stray from thy commandments.
11 ^ In corde meo abscòndui elóqŭia tua
column2: ut non peccem tìbi. ^ Thy words have I hidden in my heart
column3: that I may not sin against thee.

column1: 12 ^ Benedìctus ès Dòmine~; dòce me justificatiónes tuas. ^ Blessed art thou
column2: O Lord~; teach me thy justifications.

column1: 13 ^ In lábiîs meîs pronuntiávi òmnia judìcia oris tui. ^ With my lips I have pronounced all the judgments of thy mouth.
14 ^ In via testimoniórum tuórum delectátus sum
column2: sicut in òmnibus divìtiîs. ^ I have been delighted in the way of thy testimonies
column3: as in all riches.

column1: 15 ^ In mandátîs tuîs exercébor
column2: et considerábo vias tuas. ^ I will meditate on thy commandments
column3: and I will consider thy ways.

column1: 16 ^ In justificatiónibus tuîs meditábor~; non oblivíscer sermónes tuos. ^ I will think of thy justifications~; I will not forget thy words.
17 ^ Retrìbue servo tuo~; vivìfica me
column2: et custódiem sermónes tuos. ^ Give bountifully to thy servant~; enliven me
column3: and I shall keep thy words.

column1: 18 ^ Revéla òculos meos
column2: et considerábo mirabìlia de lege tua. ^ Open thou my eyes
column3: and I will consider the wondrous things of thy law.

column1: 19 ^ Ìncola ego sum in terra~; non abscòndas a me mandáta tua. ^ I am a sojourner on the earth~; do not hide thy commandments from me.
20 ^ Concupívit ánima mea desideráre justificatiónes tuas in omni tèmpore. ^ My soul hath coveted to long for thy justifications at all times.
21 ^ Increpavìsti supèrbos~; maledìcti qŭi declínant a mandátîs tuîs. ^ Thou hast rebuked the proud~; they are cursed who decline from thy commandments.
22 ^ Aŭfer a me oppróbrium et contèmptum
column2: qŭia testimónia tua exqŭisívi. ^ Remove from me reproach and contempt
column3: because I have sought after thy testimonies.

column1: 23 ^ Ètenim sedérunt príncipes
column2: et advèrsum me loquebántur~; servus aŭtem tuus exercebátur in justificatiónibus tuîs. ^ For princes sat
column3: and spoke against me~; yet thy servant was employed in thy justifications.

column1: 24 ^ Nam et testimónia tua meditátio mea èst
column2: et consìlium meum justificatiónes tuaĕ. ^ For thy testimonies are my meditation
column3: and thy justifications my counsel.

column1: 25 ^ Adhaĕsit pavimènto ánima mea~; vivìfica me secùndum verbum tuum. ^ My soul hath cleaved to the pavement~; quicken thou me according to thy word.
26 ^ Vias meas enuntiávi
column2: et exaŭdivìsti me~; dòce me justificatiónes tuas. ^ I have declared my ways
column3: and thou hast heard me~; teach me thy justifications.

column1: 27 ^ Viam justificatiónum tuárum ìnstrue me
column2: et exercébor in mirabìlibus tuîs. ^ Make me to understand the way of thy justifications
column3: and I shall be exercised in thy wondrous works.

column1: 28 ^ Dormitávit ánima mea praĕ táĕdio~; confìrma me in verbîs tuîs. ^ My soul hath slumbered through heaviness~; strengthen thou me in thy words.
29 ^ Viam iniqŭitátis ámove a me
column2: et de lege tua miserére mei. ^ Remove from me the way of iniquity
column3: and out of thy law have mercy on me.

column1: 30 ^ Viam veritátis elégi~; judìcia tua non sum oblítus. ^ I have chosen the way of truth~; thy judgments I have not forgotten.
31 ^ Adháĕsi testimóniîs tuîs
column2: Dòmine~; noli me confùndere. ^ I have stuck to thy testimonies
column3: O Lord~; put me not to shame.

column1: 32 ^ Viam mandatórum tuórum cucùrri
column2: qŭum dilatavìsti cor meum. ^ I have run the way of thy commandments
column3: when thou didst enlarge my heart.

column1: 33 ^ Legem pone mìhi
column2: Dòmine
column3: viam justificatiónum tuárum
column4: et exquíram eam semper. ^ Set for me a law
column5: O Lord
column7: and I will always seek after it.

column1: 34 ^ Da mìhi intelléctum
column2: et scrutábor legem tuam
column3: et custódiem illam in toto corde meo. ^ Give me understanding
column4: and I will search thy law
column5: and I will keep it with my whole heart.

column1: 35 ^ Dedúce me in sémitam mandatórum tuórum
column2: qŭia ipsam vólui. ^ Lead me into the path of thy commandments
column3: for I have desired it.

column1: 36 ^ Inclína cor meum in testimónia tua
column2: et non in avarìtiam. ^ Incline my heart into thy testimonies
column3: and not to covetousness.

column1: 37 ^ Avèrte òculos meos ne vìdeant vanitátem~; in via tua vivìfica me. ^ Turn away my eyes that they may not behold vanity~; quicken me in thy way.
38 ^ Státue servo tuo elóqŭium tuum in timóre tuo. ^ Establish thy word to thy servant in thy fear.
39 ^ Ámputa oppróbrium meum qŭod suspicátus sum
column2: qŭia judìcia tua jucùnda. ^ Turn away my reproach which I have apprehended
column3: for thy judgments are delightful.

column1: 40 ^ Ecce concupívi mandáta tua~; in aĕqŭitáte tua vivìfica me. ^ Behold I have longed after thy precepts~; quicken me in thy justice.
41 ^ Et vèniat super me misericórdia tua
column2: Dòmine~; salutáre tuum secùndum elóqŭium tuum. ^ And let thy mercy also come upon me
column3: O Lord~; thy salvation according to thy word.

column1: 42 ^ Et respondébo exprobrántibus mìhi verbum
column2: qŭia sperávi in sermónibus tuîs. ^ And I shall answer them that reproach me in any thing~; that I have trusted in thy words.

column1: 43 ^ Et ne áŭferas de ore meo verbum veritátis usquequáque
column2: qŭia in judìciîs tuîs supersperávi. ^ And take not thou the word of truth utterly out of my mouth
column3: for in thy words I have hoped exceedingly.

column1: 44 ^ Et custódiem legem tuam semper
column2: in sáĕculum et in sáĕculum sáĕculi. ^ And I shall always keep thy law
column3: for ever and for ever and ever.

column1: 45 ^ Et ambulábam in latitúdine
column2: qŭia mandáta tua exqŭisívi. ^ And I walked at large
column3: because I have sought after thy commandments.

column1: 46 ^ Et loqŭébar in testimóniîs tuîs in conspèctu regum
column2: et non confundébar. ^ And I spoke of thy testimonies before kings
column3: and I was not ashamed.

column1: 47 ^ Et meditábar in mandátîs tuîs
column2: qŭaĕ diléxi. ^ And I meditated on thy commandments
column3: which I loved.

column1: 48 ^ Et levávi manûs meas ad mandáta tua
column2: qŭaĕ diléxi
column3: et exercébar in justificatiónibus tuîs. ^ And I lifted up my hands to thy commandments
column5: and I was exercised in thy justifications.

column1: 49 ^ Mèmor èsto verbi tui servo tuo
column2: in qŭo mìhi spem dedìsti. ^ Be thou mindful of thy word to thy servant
column3: in which thou hast given me hope.

column1: 50 ^ Haĕc me consoláta èst in humilitáte mea
column2: qŭia elóqŭium tuum vivificávit me. ^ This hath comforted me in my humiliation
column3: because thy word hath enlivened me.

column1: 51 ^ Súperbi iníqŭe agébant usquequáque
column2: a lege aŭtem tua non declinávi. ^ The proud did iniquitously altogether
column3: but I declined not from thy law.

column1: 52 ^ Mèmor fui judiciórum tuórum a sáĕculo Dòmine
column2: et consolátus sum. ^ I remembered
column3: O Lord
column5: and I was comforted.

column1: 53 ^ Defèctio tènuit me
column2: pro peccatóribus derelinqŭèntibus legem tuam. ^ A fainting hath taken hold of me
column3: because of the wicked that forsake thy law.

column1: 54 ^ Cantábiles mìhi èrant justificatiónes tuaĕ in loco peregrinatiónis meaĕ. ^ Thy justifications were the subject of my song
column2: in the place of my pilgrimage.

column1: 55 ^ Mèmor fui nocte nóminis tui Dòmine
column2: et custodívi legem tuam. ^ In the night I have remembered thy name
column3: O Lord

column1: 56 ^ Haĕc facta èst mìhi
column2: qŭia justificatiónes tuas exqŭisívi. ^ This happened to me
column3: because I sought after thy justifications.

column1: 57 ^ Portio mea
column2: Dòmine~; dixi custodíre legem tuam. ^ My portion
column3: O Lord~; I have said I would keep thy law.

column1: 58 ^ Deprecátus sum fáciem tuam in toto corde meo~; miserére mei secùndum elóqŭium tuum. ^ I entreated thy face with all my heart~; have mercy on me according to thy word.
59 ^ Cogitávi vias meas
column2: et convèrtui pèdes meos in testimónia tua. ^ I have thought on my ways
column3: and turned my feet unto thy testimonies.

column1: 60 ^ Parátus sum
column2: et non sum turbátus
column3: ut custódiam mandáta tua. ^ I am ready
column5: that I may keep thy commandments.

column1: 61 ^ Funes peccatórum circumplèxi sunt me
column2: et legem tuam non sum oblítus. ^ The cords of the wicked have encompassed me
column3: but I have not forgotten thy law.

column1: 62 ^ Mèdia nocte surgébam
column2: ad confitèndum tìbi super judìcia justificatiónis tuaĕ. ^ I rose at midnight to give praise to thee
column3: for the judgments of thy justification.

column1: 63 ^ Párticeps ego sum òmnium timèntium te
column2: et custodièntium mandáta tua. ^ I am a partaker with all them that fear thee
column3: and that keep thy commandments.

column1: 64 ^ Misericórdia tua
column2: Dòmine
column3: plena èst terra~; justificatiónes tuas dòce me. ^ The earth
column5: is full of thy mercy~; teach me thy justifications.

column1: 65 ^ Bonitátem fecìsti cum servo tuo
column2: Dòmine
column3: secùndum verbum tuum. ^ Thou hast done well with thy servant
column5: according to thy word.

column1: 66 ^ Bonitátem et disciplínam et scièntiam dòce me
column2: qŭia mandátîs tuîs crédidi. ^ Teach me goodness and discipline and knowledge
column3: for I have believed thy commandments.

column1: 67 ^ Priùsquam humiliárer ego delíqui~; proptèrea elóqŭium tuum custodívi. ^ Before I was humbled I offended~; therefore have I kept thy word.
68 ^ Bonus ès tu
column2: et in bonitáte tua dòce me justificatiónes tuas. ^ Thou art good
column3: and in thy goodness teach me thy justifications.

column1: 69 ^ Multiplicáta èst super me iníqŭitas superbórum~; ego aŭtem in toto corde meo scrutábor mandáta tua. ^ The iniquity of the proud hath been multiplied over me~; but I will seek thy commandments with my whole heart.
70 ^ Coagulátum èst sicut lac cor eórum~; ego vero legem tuam meditátus sum. ^ Their heart is curdled like milk~; but I have meditated on thy law.
71 ^ Bonum mìhi qŭia humiliavìsti me
column2: ut dìscam justificatiónes tuas. ^ It is good for me that thou hast humbled me
column3: that I may learn thy justifications.

column1: 72 ^ Bonum mìhi lex oris tui
column2: super mìllia aŭri et argènti. ^ The law of thy mouth is good to me
column3: above thousands of gold and silver.

column1: 73 ^ Manûs tuaĕ fecérunt me
column2: et plasmavérunt me~; da mìhi intelléctum
column3: et dìscam mandáta tua. ^ Thy hands have made me and formed me~; give me understanding
column4: and I will learn thy commandments.

column1: 74 ^ Qŭi tìment te vidébunt me
column2: et laĕtabùntur
column3: qŭia in verba tua supersperávi. ^ They that fear thee shall see me
column5: because I have greatly hoped in thy words.

column1: 75 ^ Cognóvi
column2: Dòmine
column3: qŭia áĕqŭitas judìcia tua
column4: et in veritáte tua humiliavìsti me. ^ I know
column5: O Lord
column7: and in thy truth thou hast humbled me.

column1: 76 ^ Fiat misericórdia tua ut consolétur me
column2: secùndum elóqŭium tuum servo tuo. ^ O let thy mercy be for my comfort
column3: according to thy word unto thy servant.

column1: 77 ^ Vèniant mìhi miseratiónes tuaĕ
column2: et vivam
column3: qŭia lex tua meditátio mea èst. ^ Let thy tender mercies come unto me
column5: for thy law is my meditation.

column1: 78 ^ Confundántur supèrbi
column2: qŭia injúste iniqŭitátem fecérunt in me~; ego aŭtem exercébor in mandátîs tuîs. ^ Let the proud be ashamed
column3: because they have done unjustly towards me~; but I will be employed in thy commandments.

column1: 79 ^ Convertántur mìhi timèntes te
column2: et qŭi novérunt testimónia tua. ^ Let them that fear thee turn to me
column3: and they that know thy testimonies.

column1: 80 ^ Fiat cor meum immaculátum in justificatiónibus tuîs
column2: ut non confùndar. ^ Let my heart be undefiled in thy justifications
column3: that I may not be confounded.

column1: 81 ^ Defécit in salutáre tuum ánima mea
column2: et in verbum tuum supersperávi. ^ My soul hath fainted after thy salvation
column3: and in thy word I have very much hoped.

column1: 82 ^ Defecérunt òculi mei in elóqŭium tuum
column2: dicèntes
column3: «~¿~Quando consoláberis me~?~». ^ My eyes have failed for thy word
column5: "When wilt thou comfort me~?"

column1: 83 ^ Qŭia factus sum sicut uter in pruína~; justificatiónes tuas non sum oblítus. ^ For I am become like a bottle in the frost~; I have not forgotten thy justifications.
84 ^ ¿~Quot sunt dies servi tui~? ¿~Quando fácies de perseqŭèntibus me judìcium~? ^ How many are the days of thy servant~? When wilt thou execute judgment on them that persecute me~?
85 ^ Narravérunt mìhi iníqŭi fabulatiónes
column2: sed non ut lex tua. ^ The wicked have told me fables
column3: but not as thy law.

column1: 86 ^ Òmnia mandáta tua vèritas~; iníqŭe persecúti sunt me~; ádjuva me. ^ All thy statutes are truth~; they have persecuted me unjustly; do thou help me.
87 ^ Paŭlo mìnus consummavérunt me in terra~; ego aŭtem non derelíqui mandáta tua. ^ They had almost made an end of me upon earth~; but I have not forsaken thy commandments.
88 ^ Secùndum misericórdiam tuam vivìfica me
column2: et custódiem testimónia oris tui. ^ Quicken thou me according to thy mercy
column3: and I shall keep the testimonies of thy mouth.

column1: 89 ^ In aĕtèrnum
column2: Dòmine
column3: verbum tuum pèrmanet in caĕlo. ^ For ever
column5: thy word standeth firm in heaven.

column1: 90 ^ In generatiónem et generatiónem vèritas tua~; fundavìsti terram
column2: et pèrmanet. ^ Thy truth unto all generations~; thou hast founded the earth
column3: and it continueth.

column1: 91 ^ Ordinatióne tua persevérat dies
column2: qŭóniam òmnia sèrviunt tìbi. ^ By thy ordinance the day goeth on
column3: for all things serve thee.

column1: 92 ^ Nisi qŭod lex tua meditátio mea èst
column2: tunc forte perivìssem in humilitáte mea. ^ Unless thy law had been my meditation
column3: I had then perhaps perished in my abjection.

column1: 93 ^ In aĕtèrnum non oblivíscer justificatiónes tuas
column2: qŭia in ipsîs vivificavìsti me. ^ Thy justifications I will never forget
column3: for by them thou hast given me life.

column1: 94 ^ Tuus sum ego~; salvum me fac
column2: qŭóniam justificatiónes tuas exqŭisívi. ^ I am thine~; save thou me
column3: for I have sought thy justifications.

column1: 95 ^ Me expectavérunt peccatóres ut pèrderent me~; testimónia tua intelléxi. ^ The wicked have waited for me to destroy me~; I have understood thy testimonies.
96 ^ Omnis consummatiónis vîdi finem
column2: latum mandátum tuum nìmis. ^ I have seen an end of all perfection~; thy commandment is exceeding broad.

column1: 97 ^ Qŭómodo diléxi legem tuam
column2: Dòmine~; tota die meditátio mea èst. ^ O how have I loved thy law
column3: O Lord~; it is my meditation all the day.

column1: 98 ^ Super inimícos meos prudèntem me fecìsti mandáto tuo
column2: qŭia in aĕtèrnum mìhi èst. ^ Through thy commandment
column3: thou hast made me wiser than my enemies
column4: for it is ever with me.

column1: 99 ^ Super omnes docèntes me intelléxi
column2: qŭia testimónia tua meditátio mea èst. ^ I have understood more than all my teachers
column3: because thy testimonies are my meditation.

column1: 100 ^ Super sènes intelléxi
column2: qŭia mandáta tua qŭaĕsívi. ^ I have had understanding above ancients
column3: because I have sought thy commandments.

column1: 101 ^ Ab omni via mala prohìbui pèdes meos
column2: ut custódiam verba tua. ^ I have restrained my feet from every evil way
column3: that I may keep thy words.

column1: 102 ^ A judìciîs tuîs non declinávi
column2: qŭia tu legem posuìsti mìhi. ^ I have not declined from thy judgments
column3: because thou hast set me a law.

column1: 103 ^ Quam dùlcia fáŭcibus meîs elóqŭia tua
column2: super mel ori meo. ^ How sweet are thy words to my palate
column3: more than honey to my mouth.

column1: 104 ^ A mandátîs tuîs intelléxi~; proptèrea odívi omnem viam iniqŭitátis. ^ By thy commandments I have had understanding
column2: therefore have I hated every way of iniquity.

column1: 105 ^ Lucèrna pèdibus meîs verbum tuum
column2: et lumen sémitîs meîs. ^ Thy word is a lamp to my feet
column3: and a light to my paths.

column1: 106 ^ Jurávi et statúvi custodíre judìcia justìtiaĕ tuaĕ. ^ I have sworn and am determined to keep the judgments of thy justice.
107 ^ Humiliátus sum usquequáque
column2: Dòmine~; vivìfica me secùndum verbum tuum. ^ I have been humbled exceedingly
column3: O Lord~; quicken thou me according to thy word.

column1: 108 ^ Voluntária oris mei beneplácita fac
column2: Dòmine
column3: et judìcia tua dòce me. ^ The free offerings of my mouth make acceptable
column5: and teach me thy judgments.

column1: 109 ^ Ánima mea in mánibus meîs semper
column2: et legem tuam non sum oblítus. ^ My soul is continually in my hands
column3: and I have not forgotten thy law.

column1: 110 ^ Posuérunt peccatóres láqueum mìhi
column2: et de mandátîs tuîs non errávi. ^ Sinners have laid a snare for me
column3: but I have not erred from thy precepts.

column1: 111 ^ Hereditáte acquisívi testimónia tua in aĕtèrnum
column2: qŭia exsultátio cordis mei sunt. ^ I have purchased thy testimonies for an inheritance for ever
column3: because they are the joy of my heart.

column1: 112 ^ Inclinávi cor meum ad facièndas justificatiónes tuas in aĕtèrnum
column2: pròpter retributiónem. ^ I have inclined my heart to do thy justifications for ever
column3: for the reward.

column1: 113 ^ Iníqŭos ódio hábui
column2: et legem tuam diléxi. ^ I regarded the unjust transgressors with hated
column3: and have loved thy law.

column1: 114 ^ Adjútor et suscèptor meus ès tu
column2: et in verbum tuum supersperávi. ^ Thou art my helper and my protector
column3: and in thy word I have greatly hoped.

column1: 115 ^ Declináte a me
column2: malìgni
column3: et scrutábor mandáta Dei mei. ^ Depart from me
column5: and I will search the commandments of my God.

column1: 116 ^ Sùscipe me secùndum elóqŭium tuum
column2: et vivam
column3: et non confùndas me ab expectatióne mea. ^ Uphold me according to thy word
column5: and let me not be confounded in my expectation.

column1: 117 ^ Ádjuva me
column2: et salvus èro
column3: et meditábor in justificatiónibus tuîs semper. ^ Help me
column5: and I will meditate always on thy justifications.

column1: 118 ^ Sprevìsti omnes discedèntes a judìciîs tuîs
column2: qŭia injústa cogitátio eórum. ^ Thou hast despised all them that fall off from thy judgments
column3: for their thought is unjust.

column1: 119 ^ Praĕvaricántes reputávi omnes peccatóres terraĕ~; ìdeo diléxi testimónia tua. ^ I have accounted all the sinners of the earth prevaricators
column2: therefore have I loved thy testimonies.

column1: 120 ^ Confíge timóre tuo carnes meas~; a judìciîs enim tuîs tìmui. ^ Pierce thou my flesh with thy fear
column2: for I am afraid of thy judgments.

column1: 121 ^ Feci judìcium et justìtiam~; non tradas me calumniántibus me. ^ I have done judgment and justice~; give me not up to them that slander me.
122 ^ Sùscipe servum tuum in bonum~; non calumnièntur me supèrbi. ^ Uphold thy servant unto good~; let not the proud calumniate me.
123 ^ Òculi mei defecérunt in salutáre tuum
column2: et in elóqŭium justìtiaĕ tuaĕ. ^ My eyes have fainted after thy salvation
column3: and for the word of thy justice.

column1: 124 ^ Fac cum servo tuo secùndum misericórdiam tuam
column2: et justificatiónes tuas dòce me. ^ Deal with thy servant according to thy mercy
column3: and teach me thy justifications.

column1: 125 ^ Servus tuus sum ego~; da mìhi intelléctum
column2: ut sciam testimónia tua. ^ I am thy servant~; give me understanding that I may know thy testimonies.

column1: 126 ^ Tempus facièndi
column2: Dòmine~; dissipavérunt legem tuam. ^ It is time
column3: O Lord
column4: to act~; they have dissipated thy law.

column1: 127 ^ Ìdeo diléxi mandáta tua super aŭrum et topazióntem. ^ Therefore have I loved thy commandments above gold and the topaz.
128 ^ Proptèrea ad òmnia mandáta tua dirigébar~; omnem viam iníqŭam ódio hábui. ^ Therefore was I directed to all thy commandments~; I regarded with hated all wicked ways.
129 ^ Mirabìlia testimónia tua~; ìdeo scrutáta èst ea ánima mea. ^ Thy testimonies are wonderful~; therefore my soul hath sought them.
130 ^ Declarátio sermónum tuórum illúminat
column2: et intelléctum dat párvulîs. ^ The declaration of thy words giveth light
column3: and giveth understanding to little ones.

column1: 131 ^ Os meum apèrui
column2: et attráxi spíritum
column3: qŭia mandáta tua desiderábam. ^ I opened my mouth
column5: because I longed for thy commandments.

column1: 132 ^ Áspice in me
column2: et miserére mei
column3: secùndum judìcium diligèntium nomen tuum. ^ Look thou upon me
column5: according to the judgment of them that love thy name.

column1: 133 ^ Gressûs meos dírige secùndum elóqŭium tuum
column2: et non dominétur mei omnis injustìtia. ^ Direct my steps according to thy word
column3: and let no iniquity have dominion over me.

column1: 134 ^ Rèdime me a calùmniîs hòminum
column2: ut custódiam mandáta tua. ^ Redeem me from the calumnies of men
column3: that I may keep thy commandments.

column1: 135 ^ Fáciem tuam illúmina super servum tuum
column2: et dòce me justificatiónes tuas. ^ Make thy face to shine upon thy servant
column3: and teach me thy justifications.

column1: 136 ^ Èxitûs aquárum deduxérunt òculi mei
column2: qŭia non custodivérunt legem tuam. ^ My eyes have sent forth springs of water
column3: because they have not kept thy law.

column1: 137 ^ Justus ès Dòmine
column2: et rectum judìcium tuum. ^ Thou art just
column3: O Lord

column1: 138 ^ Mandavìsti justìtiam testimónia tua
column2: et veritátem tuam nìmis. ^ Thou hast commanded justice thy testimonies
column3: and thy truth exceedingly.

column1: 139 ^ Tabéscere me fecit zelus meus
column2: qŭia oblíti sunt verba tua inimíci mei. ^ My zeal hath made me pine away
column3: because my enemies forgot thy words.

column1: 140 ^ Ignítum elóqŭium tuum vehemènter
column2: et servus tuus diléxit illud. ^ Thy word is exceedingly refined
column3: and thy servant hath loved it.

column1: 141 ^ Adolescèntulus sum ego et contèmptus~; justificatiónes tuas non sum oblítus. ^ I am very young and despised~; thy justifications I did not forget.
142 ^ Justìtia tua justìtia in aĕtèrnum
column2: et lex tua vèritas. ^ Thy justice is justice for ever
column3: and thy law is the truth.

column1: 143 ^ Tribulátio et angùstia invenérunt me~; mandáta tua meditátio mea èst. ^ Trouble and anguish have found me~; thy commandments are my meditation.
144 ^ Áĕqŭitas testimónia tua in aĕtèrnum~; intelléctum da mìhi
column2: et vivam. ^ Thy testimonies are justice for ever~; give me understanding
column3: and I shall live.

column1: 145 ^ Clamávi in toto corde meo
column2: exáŭdi me
column3: Dòmine~; justificatiónes tuas requírem. ^ I cried with my whole heart
column5: O Lord~; I will seek thy justifications.

column1: 146 ^ Clamávi ad te~; salvum me fac
column2: ut custódiam mandáta tua. ^ I cried unto thee~; save me
column3: that I may keep thy commandments.

column1: 147 ^ Praĕvéni in maturitáte
column2: et clamávi
column3: qŭia in verba tua supersperávi. ^ I prevented the dawning of the day
column5: because in thy words I very much hoped.

column1: 148 ^ Praĕvenérunt òculi mei ad te dilúculo
column2: ut meditárer elóqŭia tua. ^ My eyes to thee have prevented the morning
column3: that I might meditate on thy words.

column1: 149 ^ Vocem meam aŭdi secùndum misericórdiam tuam Dòmine
column2: et secùndum judìcium tuum vivìfica me. ^ Hear thou my voice
column3: O Lord
column5: and quicken me according to thy judgment.

column1: 150 ^ Appropinquavérunt persequèntes me iniquitáti
column2: a lege aŭtem tua longe facti sunt. ^ They that persecute me have drawn nigh to iniquity
column3: but they are gone far off from thy law.

column1: 151 ^ Prope ès tu Dòmine
column2: et omnes viaĕ tuaĕ vèritas. ^ Thou art near
column3: O Lord
column4: and all thy ways are truth.

column1: 152 ^ Inìtio cognóvi de testimóniîs tuîs
column2: qŭia in aĕtèrnum fundavìsti ea. ^ I have known from the beginning concerning thy testimonies
column3: that thou hast founded them for ever.

column1: 153 ^ Vìde humilitátem meam
column2: et éripe me
column3: qŭia legem tuam non sum oblítus. ^ See my humiliation
column5: for I have not forgotten thy law.

column1: 154 ^ Júdica judìcium meum
column2: et rèdime me~; pròpter elóqŭium tuum vivìfica me. ^ Judge my judgment
column3: and redeem me~; quicken thou me for thy word's sake.

column1: 155 ^ Longe a peccatóribus salûs
column2: qŭia justificatiónes tuas non exquisivérunt. ^ Salvation is far from sinners
column3: because they have not sought thy justifications.

column1: 156 ^ Misericórdiaĕ tuaĕ multaĕ
column2: Dòmine~; secùndum judìcium tuum vivìfica me. ^ Many
column3: O Lord
column4: are thy mercies~; quicken me according to thy judgment.

column1: 157 ^ Multi qŭi perseqŭùntur me
column2: et trìbulant me~; a testimóniîs tuîs non declinávi. ^ Many are they that persecute me and afflict me~; from thy testimonies I have not declined.

column1: 158 ^ Vîdi praĕvaricántes et tabescébam
column2: qŭia elóqŭia tua non custodivérunt. ^ I beheld the transgressors
column3: and pined away
column4: because they kept not thy word.

column1: 159 ^ Vìde qŭóniam mandáta tua diléxi
column2: Dòmine~; in misericórdia tua vivìfica me. ^ Behold I have loved thy commandments
column3: O Lord~; quicken me thou in thy mercy.

column1: 160 ^ princìpium verbórum tuórum vèritas~; in aĕtèrnum òmnia judìcia justìtiaĕ tuaĕ. ^ The beginning of thy words is truth~; all the judgments of thy justice are for ever.
161 ^ príncipes persecúti sunt me gratîs
column2: et a verbîs tuîs formidávit cor meum. ^ Princes have persecuted me without cause
column3: and my heart hath been in awe of thy words.

column1: 162 ^ Laĕtábor ego super elóqŭia tua
column2: sicut qŭi invénit spólia multa. ^ I will rejoice at thy words
column3: as one that hath found great spoil.

column1: 163 ^ iniqŭitátem ódio hábui
column2: et abominátus sum~; legem aŭtem tuam diléxi. ^ Iniquity I regarded with hated
column3: and I abhorred~; thy law however I have loved.

column1: 164 ^ Sèpties in die laŭdem dixi tìbi
column2: super judìcia justìtiaĕ tuaĕ. ^ Seven times a day I have given praise to thee
column3: for the judgments of thy justice.

column1: 165 ^ Pax multa diligèntibus legem tuam
column2: et non èst illîs scándalum. ^ Much peace have they that love thy law
column3: and to them there is no stumbling block.

column1: 166 ^ Expectábam salutáre tuum
column2: Dòmine
column3: et mandáta tua diléxi. ^ I looked for thy salvation
column5: and I loved thy commandments.

column1: 167 ^ Custodívit ánima mea testimónia tua
column2: et diléxit ea vehemènter. ^ My soul hath kept thy testimonies and hath loved them exceedingly.

column1: 168 ^ Servávi mandáta tua et testimónia tua
column2: qŭia omnes viaĕ meaĕ in conspèctu tuo. ^ I have kept thy commandments and thy testimonies
column3: because all my ways are in thy sight.

column1: 169 ^ Appropìnqŭet deprecátio mea in conspèctu tuo
column2: Dòmine~; juxta elóqŭium tuum da mìhi intelléctum. ^ Let my supplication
column3: O Lord
column4: come near in thy sight~; give me understanding according to thy word.

column1: 170 ^ Intret postulátio mea in conspèctu tuo~; secùndum elóqŭium tuum éripe me. ^ Let my request come in before thee~; deliver thou me according to thy word.
171 ^ Eructábunt lábia mea himnum
column2: qŭum docùerîs me justificatiónes tuas. ^ My lips shall utter a hymn
column3: when thou shalt teach me thy justifications.

column1: 172 ^ Pronuntiábit lingŭa mea elóqŭium tuum
column2: qŭia òmnia mandáta tua áĕqŭitas. ^ My tongue shall pronounce thy word
column3: because all thy commandments are justice.

column1: 173 ^ Fiat manus tua ut salvet me
column2: qŭóniam mandáta tua elégi. ^ Let thy hand be with me to save me~; for I have chosen thy precepts.

column1: 174 ^ Concupívi salutáre tuum
column2: Dòmine
column3: et lex tua meditátio mea èst. ^ I have longed for thy salvation
column5: and thy law is my meditation.

column1: 175 ^ Vivet ánima mea
column2: et laŭdábit te
column3: et judìcia tua adjuvábunt me. ^ My soul shall live
column5: and thy judgments shall help me.

column1: 176 ^ Errávi sicut ovis qŭaĕ perívit~; qŭaĕre servum tuum
column2: qŭia mandáta tua non sum oblítus. ^ I have gone astray like a sheep that is lost~; seek thy servant
column3: because I have not forgotten thy commandments.
